intro: Sarcanthus rivesii, commonly known as the Rivesii spurge, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and fleshy, milky sap that exudes from its stems and leaves. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with similar morphological traits. Sarcanthus rivesii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
